[To be published in the Gazette of India, Extraordinary, Part II, Section 3, Sub-section
(i)]
Government of India
Ministry of Finance
Department of Revenue
Central Board of Excise and Customs
Notification No. 33/2017 – Central Tax
New Delhi, the 15th September, 2017
G.S.R. …..(E).— In exercise of the powers conferred by sub-section (3) of section 1 of the
Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017 (12 of 2017), the Central Government hereby
appoints the 18th day of September, 2017 as the date on which the provisions of sub-section
(1) of section 51 of the said Act shall come into force with respect to persons specified under
clauses (a) and (b) of sub-section (1) of section 51 of the said Act and the persons specified
below under clause (d) of sub-section (1) of section 51 of the said Act, namely:-
(a) an authority or a board or any other body, -
(i) set up by an Act of Parliament or a State Legislature; or
(ii) established by any Government,
with fifty-one percent or more participation by way of equity or control, to
carry out any function;
(b) society established by the Central Government or the State Government or a
Local Authority under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (21 of 1860);
(c) public sector undertakings:
Provided that the said persons shall be liable to deduct tax from the payment made or
credited to the supplier of taxable goods or services or both with effect from a date to be
notified subsequently, on the recommendations of the Council, by the Central Government.
[F. No. 349/58/2017-GST(Pt.)]
(Dr.Sreeparvathy S.L.)
Under Secretary to the Government of India
